newsitem.title: GERMANY: Dresdner says not a takeover candidate.
newsitem.headline: Dresdner says not a takeover candidate.

text.p: Germany's Dresdner Bank AG said on Friday it was not itself a takeover candidate and did not regard takeovers as a pressing concern for the German commercial banking industry.

"Dresdner is certainly not a takeover candidate," Dresdner chairman Juergen Sarrazin told the bank's annual general meeting in response to a question as to the bank's strategy on acquisitions on the home market.
Sarrazin also downplayed the urgency of the need for Germany's commercial banks to merge.
Tough competition and globalisation would inevitably add to pressure on German banks to consolidate, Sarrazin conceded.
"But I am not sure that this is a particularly acute issue for the private banking sector," he said.
Merger speculation has been rife in the German banking industry since market leader Deutsche Bank AG last year declared a 5.2 percent stake in Bavaria's Bayerische Vereinsbank AG.
